title: Perry Township, Wood County, Ohio
text:
Perry Township is one of the nineteen <a href="civil%20township">townships</a> of <a href="Wood%20County%2C%20Ohio">Wood County</a>, <a href="Ohio">Ohio</a>, United States. The <a href="2010%20United%20States%20Census">2010 census</a> found 1,605 people in the township.
Geography.
Located in the southeastern corner of the county, it borders the following townships:
Part of the city of <a href="Fostoria%2C%20Ohio">Fostoria</a> is located in southeastern Perry Township, and the village of <a href="West%20Millgrove%2C%20Ohio">West Millgrove</a> lies in the township's north.
Name and history.
Perry Township was established in 1833. It is one of twenty-six <a href="Perry%20Township%2C%20Ohio%20%28disambiguation%29">Perry Townships statewide</a>.
Government.
The township is governed by a three-member board of trustees, who are elected in November of odd-numbered years to a four-year term beginning on the following January 1. Two are elected in the year after the presidential election and one is elected in the year before it. There is also an elected township fiscal officer, who serves a four-year term beginning on April 1 of the year after the election, which is held in November of the year before the presidential election. Vacancies in the fiscal officership or on the board of trustees are filled by the remaining trustees.
